intro: Didymopanax morototoni var. angustipetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petioled sycoglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its bark is thick and fibrous, and it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
